sentences.cn: 她既是母亲，同时还担任着公司董事。

sentences.en: It’s a public relations office, a press office and a private office all in one.
sentences.cn: 那儿既是公关办公室，也是新闻办公室，又是私人办公室，三位一体。

means.word_mean: 几乎可以肯定…(不)会做某事

sentences.en: It’s a hundred to one that the train will be late.
sentences.cn: 火车肯定会晚点。

sentences.en: It’s a million to one that she’ll finish before us. She always does.
sentences.cn: 我敢说她一定会比我们先完成，她总是这样。

sentences.en: The bills kept coming in, one after another.
sentences.cn: 账单一张接一张，不停地送来。

sentences.en: Happy New Year to one and all!
sentences.cn: 祝各位新年快乐！

means.word_mean: (用于强调)有名的，绝无仅有的， 唯一的

sentences.en: That was the one and only James Brown, with ‘Try me’.
sentences.cn: 感谢著名的詹姆斯·布朗为我们演唱了“尝试”。

sentences.en: My trip to France is the one and only time I’ve been out of the country.
sentences.cn: 我的法国之行是我唯一的一次出国旅行。

sentences.en: In some countries, the police and the army are one and the same thing.
sentences.cn: 在某些国家，警察就是军队。

sentences.en: She read all of Agatha Christie’s novels one by one.
sentences.cn: 她逐一读完了阿加莎·克里斯蒂的小说。

sentences.en: One by one the guests left.
sentences.cn: 客人一位接一位地离开了。

sentences.en: I don’t like science fiction novels much. When you’ve read one, you’ve read them all.
sentences.cn: 我不怎么喜欢科幻小说，它们都大同小异。

means.word_mean: （用于一般地谈论过去或将来的某个时间）
（用来避免重复已提过的或是听者已知的事物的名称
（举止）有趣的人，令人惊奇的人

sentences.en: I met her one afternoon in June.
sentences.cn: 六月的一天下午我遇到了她。

jx.jx_en_mean: used to stress that the person named holds the specified view, even if no one else does
jx.jx_cn_mean: 仅就（某人）来看；举个例说

lj.lj_ly: I for one am getting a little sick of writing about it.
lj.lj_ls: 仅就我来看，我开始有点厌恶写关于这件事的东西了。

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)understand or succeed in guessing something immediately
following one another in quick succession

lj.lj_ly: one after another the buses drew up.
lj.lj_ls: 公共汽车一辆接一辆地停下来。

jx.jx_en_mean: unique; single (used for emphasis or as a designation of a celebrity)

lj.lj_ly: the title of his one and only book.
lj.lj_ls: 他唯一的一本书的名字。

lj.lj_ly: the one and only Muhammad Ali.
lj.lj_ls: 独一无二的穆罕默德•阿里。

jx.jx_en_mean: at a particular but unspecified time in the past or future

lj.lj_ly: one day a boy started teasing Grady.
lj.lj_ls: 一天，一个男孩开始取笑格雷迪。

lj.lj_ly: he would one day be a great President.
lj.lj_ls: 他有一天会成为一位伟大的总统。

jx.jx_en_mean: denoting or referring to a situation or arrangement in which one thing corresponds to or is exchanged for another

lj.lj_ly: these donations would be matched on a one-for-one basis with public revenues.
lj.lj_ls: 这些捐款将会与公共收入一对一匹配。

lj.lj_ly: these donations would be matched on a one-for-one basis with public revenues.
lj.lj_ls: 这些捐款将会与公共收入一对一匹配。

phrase.cizu_name: one on one (或 one to one)

jx.jx_en_mean: denoting or referring to a situation in which two parties come into direct contact, opposition, or correspondence

lj.lj_ly: maybe we should talk to them one on one.
lj.lj_ls: 或许我们应该和他们当面谈谈。

jx.jx_en_mean: denoting or referring to a particular but unspecified one out of a set of items
jx.jx_cn_mean: 一系列事物中的某一个

lj.lj_ly: not all instances fall neatly into one or another of these categories.
lj.lj_ls: 不是所有的情况都可清楚地归于这些类别中的某一类。

lj.lj_ly: there are one or two signs worth watching for.
lj.lj_ls: 有一些值得注意的标记。

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)used to cover various unspecified matters, events, or tasks
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)这样那样的事（泛指许多事情）

lj.lj_ly: &B{what with one thing and another} she hadn't had much sleep recently.
lj.lj_ls: 她最近因为这样那样的事情而睡得不多。

entry.def: One is the number 1.
entry.tran: （数字）1

example.ex: They had three sons and one daughter.
example.tran: 他们有3个儿子，1个女儿。

example.ex: ...one thousand years ago...

entry.def: If you say that someone or something is the one person or thing of a particular kind, you are emphasizing that they are the only person or thing of that kind.
entry.tran: 唯一的；仅有的

example.ex: They had alienated the one man who knew the business...
example.tran: 他们弄僵了同那个唯一懂行的人之间的关系。

example.ex: His one regret is that he has never learned a language.
example.tran: 他唯一的遗憾是从未学过一门外语。

entry.def: One can be used instead of 'a' to emphasize the following noun.
entry.tran: （用于代替a以强调之后的名词）

example.ex: There is one thing I would like to know—What is it about Tim that you find so irresistible?...
example.tran: 有一件事我很想知道——蒂姆到底哪一点让你对他如此倾心？

example.ex: One person I hate is Russ.
example.tran: 让我讨厌的一个人是拉斯。

entry.def: You can use one instead of 'a' to emphasize the following adjective or expression.
entry.tran: （用于代替a以强调之后的形容词或短语）

example.ex: If we ever get married we'll have one terrific wedding...
example.tran: 如果我们哪一天结婚的话，一定会有一个棒极了的婚礼。

example.ex: It's like one enormous street carnival here.
example.tran: 这就像是一场盛大的街头狂欢节。

entry.def: You can use one in front of someone's name to indicate that you have not met them or heard of them before.
entry.tran: （用于人名前，表示未曾相识或听闻的）某一个

example.ex: It seems that the fifth man is one John Cairncross.
example.tran: 第五位好像是一个名叫约翰·凯恩克罗斯的人。

entry.def: You can use one to refer to the first of two or more things that you are comparing.
entry.tran: （表示与其他的作比较）这一个

example.ex: Prices vary from one shop to another...
example.tran: 各家商店价格不同。

example.ex: The road hugs the coast for hundreds of miles, the South China Sea on one side, jungle on the other.
example.tran: 这条路依傍海岸绵延数百英里，一边是南中国海，另一边则是丛林。

entry.def: You can use one or ones instead of a noun when it is clear what type of thing or person you are referring to and you are describing them or giving more information about them.
entry.tran: （用于代替名词，指代某类明确的人或事物）

example.ex: They are selling their house to move to a smaller one...
example.tran: 他们正打算卖掉房子，然后搬到一个小一点的住处。

example.ex: We test each one to see that it flies well.
example.tran: 我们对每架飞机都会进行测试，以确保其飞行性能良好。

entry.def: You use ones to refer to people in general.
entry.tran: （泛指）人们

example.ex: We are the only ones who know.
example.tran: 我们是唯一的知情者。

entry.def: You can use one instead of a noun group when you have just mentioned something and you want to describe it or give more information about it.
entry.tran: （用于代替名词词组，表示刚提到过的事物）

example.ex: His response is one of anger and frustration...
example.tran: 他的回答充满了愤怒和懊丧。

example.ex: The issue of land reform was one that dominated Hungary's parliamentary elections.
example.tran: 土地改革是左右匈牙利议会选举的主要问题。

entry.def: You can use one when you have been talking or writing about a group of people or things and you want to say something about a particular member of the group.
entry.tran: （特指一群人或事物中的）一人，一个

example.ex: 'A college degree isn't enough', said one honors student.
example.tran: “光有一个大学学位还不够，”一位优等生说。

entry.def: You use one in expressions such as 'one of the biggest airports' or 'one of the most experienced players' to indicate that something or someone is bigger or more experienced than most other things or people of the same kind.
entry.tran: （同类事物或人中）（最…之）一

example.ex: Subaru is one of the smallest Japanese car makers.
example.tran: 斯巴鲁是日本最小的汽车制造商之一。

entry.def: You can use one when referring to a time in the past or in the future. For example, if you say that you did something one day, you mean that you did it on a day in the past.
entry.tran: （过去或将来的）某一（时刻）

example.ex: How would you like to have dinner one night, just you and me?...
example.tran: 哪天晚上一起吃饭怎么样？就咱俩。

example.ex: Then one evening Harry phoned, asking me to come to their flat as soon as possible.
example.tran: 后来一天晚上哈里打电话来，叫我尽快到他们的公寓去。

entry.def: You can use one to refer to a question, joke, remark, or subject of discussion.
entry.tran: （指代问题、笑话、评论、讨论的主题等）一个

example.ex: This is a tricky one to answer...
example.tran: 这是个难以回答的问题。

example.ex: Have you heard the one about the Irishman, the Englishman and the American?...
example.tran: 你听过那个关于爱尔兰人、英国人和美国人的笑话吗？

entry.def: You can use one to refer to an alcoholic drink.
entry.tran: (一杯)酒

example.ex: Other members of the committee drifted in for a quick one before closing time.
example.tran: 委员会的其他成员陆续走了进来，想要趁关门前喝上一杯。

entry.def: You use one to make statements about people in general which also apply to themselves. One can be used as the subject or object of a sentence.
entry.tran: （泛指包括自己的人，可作句子的主语或宾语）一个人，任何人

example.ex: If one looks at the longer run, a lot of positive things are happening...
example.tran: 如果把目光放长远些，就会发现很多积极的事情正在发生。

example.ex: Where does one go from there?...
example.tran: 从那里可以去什么地方？

entry.def: If a group of people does something as one, all the people do the same thing at the same time or in the same way.
entry.tran: 一起；一致地

example.ex: The 40,000 crowd rose as one.
example.tran: 40,000人全体起立。

entry.def: If you say that someone is one for or is a one for something, you mean that they like or approve of it or enjoy doing it.
entry.tran: 喜欢（或赞成、乐于）…的人

example.ex: I'm not one for political discussions...
example.tran: 我不是个热衷于谈论政治的人。

example.ex: She was a real one for flirting with the boys.
example.tran: 她是个情场高手。

entry.def: You can use for one to emphasize that a particular person is definitely reacting or behaving in a particular way, even if other people are not.
entry.tran: （强调某人与众不同的反应或行为方式）举个例说

example.ex: I, for one, hope you don't get the job.
example.tran: 就我而言，我并不希望你得到那份工作。

entry.def: You can use expressions such as a hundred and one ,a thousand and one, and a million and one to emphasize that you are talking about a large number of things or people.
entry.tran: （表示强调）很多

example.ex: There are a hundred and one ways in which you can raise money.
example.tran: 筹钱的办法有很多。

entry.def: You can use in one to indicate that something is a single unit, but is made up of several different parts or has several different functions.
entry.tran: 集（若干部分或功能）为一体

example.ex: ...a love story and an adventure all in one...
example.tran: 集爱情和冒险于一体的故事

example.ex: This cream moisturises and repairs in one.
example.tran: 这种护肤霜兼具滋润和修复功能。

entry.def: You can use in ones and twos to indicate that people do things or something happens gradually and in small groups.
entry.tran: 三三两两地；零零落落地

example.ex: They lose interest and start drifting away in ones and twos.
example.tran: 他们没了兴趣，开始三三两两地走开了。

entry.def: You use one after the other or one after another to say that actions or events happen with very little time between them.
entry.tran: 一个接一个地；接连地；陆续地

example.ex: My three guitars broke one after the other...
example.tran: 我的3把吉他陆续都坏了。

example.ex: One after another, people described how hard it is for them to get medical care.
example.tran: 人们一个接一个地讲述获得医疗保健服务对于他们是何其困难。

entry.def: The one and only can be used in front of the name of an actor, singer, or other famous person when they are being introduced on a show.
entry.tran: （用于节目中介绍演员、歌手或其他名人）绝无仅有的，独一无二的

example.ex: ...one of the greatest ever rock performers, the one and only Tina Turner.
example.tran: 史上最伟大的摇滚乐手之一，举世无双的蒂娜·特纳

entry.def: You can use one by one to indicate that people do things or that things happen in sequence, not all at the same time.
entry.tran: 逐个地；依次地

example.ex: We went into the room one by one...
example.tran: 我们挨个儿走进房间。

example.ex: One by one the houses burst into flames.
example.tran: 房子一幢接一幢地燃起熊熊大火。

entry.def: You use one or other to refer to one or more things or people in a group, when it does not matter which particular one or ones are thought of or chosen.
entry.tran: （一组事物或人之中的）或者这个或者那个，有一个

example.ex: One or other of the two women was wrong.
example.tran: 这两个女人当中有一个人错了。

entry.def: One or two means a few.
entry.tran: 一两个；几个

example.ex: We may make one or two changes...
example.tran: 我们可以作一两处改动。

example.ex: I've also sold one or two to an American publisher...
example.tran: 我还卖了几本给一位美国出版商。

entry.def: If you say that someone is not one to do something, you think that it is very unlikely that they would do it because it is not their normal behaviour.
entry.tran: 不大可能（做…)的人

example.ex: I'm not one to waste time on just anyone.
example.tran: 我可不是个随便浪费时间在任何人身上的人。

entry.def: If you try to get one up on someone, you try to gain an advantage over them.
entry.tran: 略胜…一筹；占…的上风

example.ex: ...the competitive kind who will see this as the opportunity to be one up on you.
example.tran: 具有竞争意识、将此视作占据上风的契机的那种人

means.word_mean: 1. the smallest whole number or a numeral representing this number;

sentences.sentence: "he has the one but will need a two and three to go with it"

means.word_mean: 1. used of a single unit or thing; not two or more;
3. having the indivisible character of a unit;
4. of the same kind or quality;
7. being the single appropriate individual of a kind; only;

sentences.sentence: "the one horse that could win this race"

means.word_mean: 8. being one in number--a single unit or thing;

sentences.sentence: "I'm just one player on the team"
"one day is just like the next"
"seen one horse and you've seen them all"

means.word_mean: 9. being a single entity made by combining separate components;

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English ān, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch een and German ein, from an Indo-European root shared by Latin unus. The initial w sound developed before the 15th cent. and was occasionally represented in the spelling; it was not accepted into standard English until the late 17th cent
